Portfolio Website
Project Overview
Inspired from a friend's resume he hosted on github.io, I started learning frontend basics to design my own resume in the form of this website. It took me a while to clearly understand the basic structure of a website.
After learning how html, css and javascript are linked together in a project I started writing code on my Visual Studio Code. The intellisense of Visual Studio helped me save a lot of time. I took inspiration from various websites on the internet to make my website look better. The main aim was to make my portfolio something different from the average. After using extensive CSS and Javascript I somewhat succeeded. After a week long process I was able to make a responsive portfolio website and hosted it to github.io. There is plan to make it better in near future, and to make a website where anyone will be able to make their own portfolio simply by inserting his/her data. This will be achieved by integrating a backend to dynamically change this site.
Go Back
Place-Hometown
Time of Work
About 1 week of learning and implementing was needed to build this site. It was built in May 2021 during Summer Holidays.
Go Back
Major Challenge: Responsive Web-Design
Resources Used and Skills Learnt
Major resources used were CodePen site, Youtube tutorials, Bootstrap docs, Loading.io site, Iconify site etc. Major skills learnt was making responsive pages, better understanding of javascript, study other websites and understand their working etc.
Specifically learning of "@media screen" in making responsive website was very important and useful.
